pred: Prior knowledge distillation techniques are ineffective in producing student models with vocabularies different from the original teacher models because they require the alignment of both models' output spaces.
answers: While there has been existing work on reducing NLP model vocabulary sizes BIBREF15, distillation techniques cannot utilize these, since they require the student and teacher models to share the same vocabulary and output space. This profoundly limits their potential to further reduce model sizes.

pred: The backoff strategies involve passing misspelled words through unchanged (pass-through), backing off to a neutral word (backoff to neutral word), or falling back upon a more generic word recognition model trained on a larger corpus (backoff to background model) when the foreground word recognition model predicts unknown words (UNK).
answers: In pass-through, the recognizer passes on the possibly misspelled word, backoff to neutral word backs off to a word with similar distribution across classes and backoff to background model backs off to a more generic word recognition model trained with larger and less specialized corpus.

Pass-through passes the possibly misspelled word as is, backoff to neutral word backs off to a word with similar distribution across classes and backoff to background model backs off to a more generic word recognition model trained with larger and less specialized corpus.

The datasets were annotated using a random sample set of 100 pairs from the 1,888 pairs to be translated by independent translators for each target language, with the translations being unique, preserving semantic relations, and selecting the best translation option when multiple translations were possible.
answers: 1. Each annotator must assign an integer score between 0 and 6 (inclusive) indicating how semantically similar the two words in a given pair are. A score of 6 indicates very high similarity (i.e., perfect synonymy), while zero indicates no similarity., 2. Each annotator must score the entire set of 1,888 pairs in the dataset.,  able to use external sources (e.g. dictionaries, thesauri, WordNet) if required, not able to communicate with each other during the annotation process
